title: Integrated stop smoking services across the Local Maternity System
text: Integrated stop smoking services across the Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity System
success: Maternity partners across the Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity System work together to enhance integrated stop smoking support for mothers and families.
update_2020: Maternity system aware of the stop smoking services available in the community. A service specification and contract for WSHT midwifery support worker led is being developed from OH funding. SASH finding opt in pathway an issue for maternity. BSUH no update available.
update_2021: 12 of 15 months into pilot programme, which is being extended for a further 6 months to the end of Sept 2021. Integrated pathway established for those needing support either within LMS or referred to community wellbeing if more suitable for patient. Report on 1st year performance of programme due March 2021
latest_update: Maternity pilot has concluded and learning will directly influence the service offer which from April 2022 is part of the NHS Long Term Plan.

title: Pilot project 'Actively Quitting' using physical activity as a diversion
text: Pilot project 'Actively Quitting' using physical activity as a diversion
success: Smokers will be referred from SSS to leisure provision
update_2020: Move to 20/21 for discussion.
update_2021: Covid-19, no change.
latest_update: Programme was not fully implemented. We will review evidence to see if there are more effective current methods to support engagement in smoking cessation services.

title: Promote e-cigarettes as a safer and healthier alternative to smoking
text: Promote e-cigarettes as a safer and healthier alternative to smoking. Work with Public Health 'approved' Vape Shops to give vouchers to bed bound clients
success: Increase in number of bed bound smokers using E-cigs instead of cigarettes
update_2020: Specialist home visiting staff are continuing to promote e-cigarettes. Whilst the current system does not record the numbers there are case studies that confirm this.
update_2021: Covid-19, no change.
latest_update: All WSCC services promote e-cigarettes in line with national guidance which currently states 95% less harmful. This information will continue to be included in safe and well visits unless evidence changes.

title: Greater sharing of intelligence to Trading Standards
text: Greater sharing of intelligence to Trading Standards
success: Increase of intel reports to Trading Standards
update_2020: Still 1% increase.
update_2021: Actual figures for past financial year Q4 – 10, Q1 – 21, Q2 – 15, Q3 – 12. Given Covid constraints percentages now a less accurate measure so continuing with actual figures as this progresses.
latest_update: Trading Standards a focal point of Smoke Free Partnership with reporting processes widely known to partners who share within their networks.

title: Enhanced maternity dataset
text: Enhanced maternity dataset ensuring smoking status recorded for all pregnant women
success: All hospitals within the local LMS footprint collect and report data.
update_2020: acutes in Sussex and east surrey are reviewing their maternity information systems including the mandatory fields including the additional 36 week field.
update_2021: Public Health working with LMS to improve datasets for analysis, this is given greater emphasis with the option of applied funding and the need for pilot evaluation data to support new funding bid.
latest_update: Maternity smoking cessation services now part of NHS Long Term Plan with integrated IT system and data capture.

title: Improve data capturing from stop smoking services
text: Improve data capturing from stop smoking services
success: Improved data quality to understand service delivery and  targeting
update_2020: In April 2019, DMF's that required further clarification or were incomplete totalled 20% of all submissions, by Oct 2019 this percentage had fallen to 7%.
update_2021: Processes are more challenging considering Covid as remote working means postal/courier service to deliver and receive forms, however data quality itself is still good with only 9% of returns needing clarification.
latest_update: Community and Pharmacy providers have fit for purpose IT system, challenges are with General Practice and challenges around finding appropriate IT solution which is on-going.

title: Produce smoking cessation gap analysis and action plan
text: Produce smoking cessation gap analysis and action plan, based on NICE guidance (PH26) and CLeaR Assessment
success: Maternity systems demonstrate enhanced stop smoking support and pathways in line with NICE guidance and CLeaR Assessments
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: Completed.
latest_update: This learning was used as part of the service redesign within the NHS Long Term Plan.

title: Report the number of people signposted
text: Report on the number of people signposted to stop smoking services from wellbeing hubs
success: Awareness of local smoking population data collected and shared
latest_update: West Sussex Wellbeing now offers a countywide smoking cessation offer as part of the programmes available to any adult over 18 who lives or works in the county. This commenced during the Covid 19 pandemic and allowed for a stop smoking offer to be in place across West Sussex at a time when other community providers were offering a much reduced service due to competing covid 19 demands. Data reporting is completed as part of the standard wellbeing quarterly reviews.

title: Share data gathered from health MOTs
text: Share data gathered from health MOTs to show the number of people identified as smokers
success: Awareness of local smoking population data collected and shared
latest_update: West Sussex Wellbeing now offers a countywide smoking cessation offer as part of the programmes available to any adult over 18 who lives or works in the county. This commenced during the Covid 19 pandemic and allowed for a stop smoking offer to be in place across West Sussex at a time when other community providers were offering a much reduced service due to competing covid 19 demands. Data reporting is completed as part of the standard wellbeing quarterly reviews.

title: Smoking status recorded for all pregnant women
text: Smoking status of all pregnant women captured at time of booking and delivery (mandatory)
success: Accurate data recorded and shared
update_2020: https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/maternity-services-data-set/maternity-services-dashboard
update_2021: Throughout LMS smoking status captured at booking appointment and support service considered opt out rather than opt in.
latest_update: This is reportable criteria for services as part of NHS Long Term Plan.

title: Refresh the Health Equity Audit for stop smoking services
text: Refresh the West Sussex Health Equity Audit for stop smoking services
success: Completed HEA used to inform service redesign
update_2020: No Jan update.
update_2021: Covid-19, recommencement to focus more on targeting those in priority need of service for 21/22.
latest_update: Data collated and in the process of being reviewed. Final version of the HEA expected in Autumn 2022.

title: Increase understanding of attitudes to smoking among Eastern Europeans
text: Increase local understanding of attitudes towards smoking among Eastern Europeans in West Sussex
success: Appropriate interventions developed based on insight
update_2020: No Jan update.
update_2021: Part of commissioning intentions for 21/22.
latest_update: Target demographic for future service provision and evidence requested to include this population in service provision moving forward.

title: Offer targeted workplace health (WPH) services
text: Target businesses in deprived areas to offer workplace health (WPH) services
success: Increase in the number of smokers accessing SSS from workplaces deprived areas
update_2020: Look at developing this further in 2020.
update_2021: Covid-19, means enhancing the offer has not been possible however once social distancing rules relax wellbeing services well placed to commence redelivery.
latest_update: Smoking cessation services now a core part of workplace offer.

title: Improving links between prisons and community stop smoking services
text: Build on national smokefree prisons programme by improving links with the community stop smoking services
success: A pathway to support those being released from prison estate to continue their stop smoking attempt
update_2020: No Jan update.
update_2021: Covid-19, no change.
latest_update: Provider details available for peer-to-peer support. Commissioner support also available to share training opportunities and service updates.

title: Use 'Actively Quitting' pilot to target disadvantaged wards
text: Use 'Actively Quitting' pilot to target disadvantaged wards
success: Smokers from disadvantaged wards will be referred from SSS to leisure provision
update_2020: Look at developing this further in 2020/21
update_2021: Covid-19, no change.
latest_update: Programme never fully implemented will review evidence to see if there are more effective current methods to support engagement in smoking cessation services.

title: Uptake of stop smoking services among substance misuse service users
text: Work with substance misuse services to improve uptake of stop smoking services by service users
success: Improved pathway for those accessing substance misuse services to support their smoking cessation
update_2020: Look at developing this further in 2021/22
update_2021: On-going work with CGL to progress support with their clientele, public health also looking to commission bespoke drug and smoking training for providers, specifically around Cannabis use.
latest_update: Current work being undertaken to provide further service training and support for cannabis and tobacco, the remainder of this action to be taken forward for consideration in future strategy.

title: Hold stop smoking surgeries in targeted community locations
text: Hold stop smoking surgeries in community locations, specifically in disadvantaged wards
success: Increase in the number of smokers accessing stop smoking services from deprived areas
partners: Wellbeing programme, Primary Care. IPEH Hubs, Voluntary Sector Organisations, District & Boroughs, Public Health
update_2020: New contract out for procurement with a focus on addressing inequalities. All Wellbeing hubs are now helping smokers to quit. In second quarter we have had an additional provider in Littlehampton.
update_2021: Covid-19, social distancing means this cant progress at present, although within wellbeing hub business plans for 21/22.
latest_update: Insight now being used to identify and target appropriate service provisions for those targeted areas.

title: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns
text: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns
success:
Evaluation of campaign reach which increases year on year. Stoptober campaign promoted in Children and Family Centres and Find it out YP Service.
Evaluation of campaign assessed by service user feedback.
Families signed up for Family Assist receive timed Stoptober information.
Lullaby Trust Safer Sleep Campaign is promoted by the Children’s Workforce in March. Smoking cessation is part of this campaign.
partners: Wellbeing programme, Health4Families, Trading Standards, District & Boroughs, Public Health
update_2020: The H4FP promoted Stoptober by disseminating key messages and information Stoptober and comms plan are ongoing. Stoptober will be evaluated in Jan when we receive the full data. We will be looking at how many came through the service and also who came through. If there is anything people have that they could feedback on that went well so we could share with PHE please let me know.
update_2021: Main focus being Stoptober and No Smoking Day, these campaigns build into new Health Matters overarching national campaign from PHE for improved health. District and boroughs as well as wellbeing programme to promote same messaging, trading standards to contribute to campaigns through awareness of illicit tobacco.
latest_update: All Smokefree Partners have positive input and support for Public Health led campaigns.

title: Annual campaign community event
text: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns through at least one annual campaign community event organised by 10 fire stations and through social media
success: Evaluation of campaign reach, which increases year on year
update_2020: The March 2020 campaign will be delivered using social media. WSFRS is currently working on targeted campaign material to support specific local risk. Smoking related fires will be one of the areas that we focus on later in the year.
update_2021: Covid-19, campaign and provider support now delivered remotely. Looking to deliver Public Health support workshops for providers in early 21/22.
latest_update: Partners support in annual No Smoking Day in March.

title: Identify approaches that best serve different communities
text: Identify approaches to disseminating smokefree messages that best serve different communities
success: Engagement with  BAME groups , particularly Eastern European to gain insight into attitudes towards tobacco use
update_2020: No Jan update.
update_2021: Complete, links with community partners established to ensure messages get are distributed through the correct medium to reach targeted communities.
latest_update: All partners can access and share insight for targeted interventions.

title: Lead on tobacco control communication and campaigns
text: Lead on tobacco control communication and campaigns
success: A communication plan for the period of this strategy is produced
update_2020: Comms plan ready. Used for Stoptober campaign. This is a standing item of the SFWSP agenda. All members to forward their plans to Heather as and when agreed.
update_2021: Comms plans to focus on Stoptober, Quit4Covid and Better Health campaigns, with support from partners. In addition to a focus on Non-Smoking Day, to be promoted by wider WSCC comms teams.
latest_update: Public Health lead on annual campaigns and call for all partners to support with these and draft comms plans accordingly.

title: Provide evidence based information via Family Assist
text: Provision of evidence based and consistent information, including on smoking cessation, to all families across West Sussex, via an easily accessed and interactive digital platform (Family Assist)
success: Family Assist achieves high levels of engagement with mothers and families in the provision of comprehensive pre-conception guidance, including on stop smoking information
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, Sussex Community NHS Foundation Trust, West Sussex County Council
update_2020: On-going.
update_2021: On-going.
latest_update: Family Assist service now concluding however have continued to provide information throughout the duration of this action plan.

title: Distribute 5,000 Safe and Well information booklets
text: Distribute 5,000 Safe and Well information booklets to residents receiving a Safe and Well visit. Booklets include information on smoking related fires, how to make a home smoke free and where to go for smoking cessation support.
success: 5,000 booklets will be distributed to vulnerable people in their homes
update_2020: Booklets started to be issued from 1st of August 2019 to 31st December 1739 booklets have been issued to residents. Training is being developed with the assistance of a Programme Manager from PH. It will support operational fire crews with using the booklets and include motivational interview techniques.
update_2021: Complete.
latest_update: Information booklets distributed to West Sussex residents.

title: Wellbeing programme that supports tobacco control
text: Develop the role of the wellbeing programme to support tobacco control
success: West Sussex wellbeing programmes are more engaged in tobacco control
update_2020: As of December 2019 all six Wellbeing Hubs are delivering the service. Collectively the Wellbeing Hubs have started intervention with 39 individuals and have already recorded 9 successful quits.
update_2021: Since inception we have had 290 clients engage with the service with 97 successful quits. Service goes from strength to strength and has been a great support to Primary care providers with additional capacity support other providers did not have during Covid-19.
latest_update: Wellbeing programme fully operational in smoking cessation delivery.

title: Redesign stop smoking service provision in West Sussex
text: Redesign stop smoking service provision in West Sussex
success: Effective stop smoking services reaching those that most need to access them
update_2020: Procurement of new smoking cessation providers is underway. New contract will commence 1st April 2020.
update_2021: Procurement completed in April 2020 with 78 primary care providers successfully tendering in addition to community wellbeing.
latest_update: Increased variation of smoking cessation providers with the addition of Wellbeing and continued provision from General Practice and Community Pharmacy.

title: Work with Vape shops to support stop smoking providers in primary care
text: Work with Vape shops to support stop smoking providers
success: Improved quit rates. Increased confidence in stop smoking providers to discuss vaping as a method to quit tobacco
update_2020: Vape pilot now live throughout Adur, Worthing and Chichester with 22 GP surgeries participating, these surgeries have all received programme guidance and vape vouchers to distribute. As of December 2019 9 starter kit vouchers had been issued to referred clients by Totally Wicked (IBVTA recognised provider). Two of these clients have returned post quit to redeem a completion voucher as well.
update_2021: Completed, evidence to be reviewed to establish if a wider audience could benefit from Vape products being added to pharmacotherapy.
latest_update: Vape pilot among General Practice and West Sussex Homeless cohort to be reviewed to see if vape products will be added to pharmacotherapy.

title: Patients are asked about their use of tobacco at pre-assessment clinics
text: All patients attending pre assessment clinic are asked about their use of tobacco. Smokers are given brief advice and signposted to local stop smoking services
success: Increase  in number of elective patients being signposted to stop smoking services
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
update_2020: No Jan update.
update_2021: What do we say about this?
latest_update: Question asked as standard as part of Long Term Plan framework.

title: Develop a Patient Group Directive around Champix prescribing
text: Develop a Patient Group Directive around Champix prescribing
success: Improved quit rates in pharmacy providers
update_2020: New conversations have begun with East Sussex to identify solutions.
update_2021: Live from Jan 2021 with variation and IT system solution implemented and training to providers being carried out in February 2021.
latest_update: Champix available as part of pharmacotherapy.

title: Improve quality of stop smoking service delivery
text: Improve quality of stop smoking service delivery
success: Improved conversion rates
update_2020: Priority scoring tool used to identify providers who may require additional support to improve service quality and delivery. Recorded site visits based on this scoring system with reduction in score proof additional support/training has been effective. As of December 2019 a total of 17 Primary Care visits have been made this quarter with a score reduction in 13.
update_2021: Priority scoring tool, utilised to improve service quality before covid, since the pandemic electronic feedback and surveys are being implemented to review service users experiences and improve if necessary.
latest_update: Priority scoring tool has evidenced an improvement in service delivery and experience of West Sussex residents engaging in smoking cessation services.

title: Improved training offer for stop smoking services
text: Improve training offer for providers of stop smoking services
success: Face to face training for new advisors in place and be spoke eLearning package for top up training
update_2020: Education for Health have now successfully delivered 4 face to face training. The Onclick e-training platform is now live and provides free CPD support to all providers when they register, there is also an assessment to ensure competency remains high.
update_2021: Education for Health have modified face to face training, to remote training due to Covid, feedback from participants is good and Public Health are looking to add additional training offers for more specific areas such as maternity. The Onclick e-training platform continues to provides free CPD support to all providers when they register, there is also an assessment to ensure competency remains high.
latest_update: On-going quarterly training sessions available for all service providers.

title: Referral and follow up to stop smoking services
text: Referral and follow up to stop smoking services whether the stop smoking intervention is inhouse or external
success: Drop in number of pregnant women still smoking at time of delivery compared to booking
update_2020: New Maternity smoking cessation post for pregnant women. Partners of pregnant women will need to continue to refer to community service for smoking cessation support
update_2021: Opt out service now established with LMS services focusing on smoking status regularly through pregnancy, work also being done with partners and smokefree homes by community wellbeing.
latest_update: Standard procedure as part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Test an integrated midwifery-led stop smoking service
text: Test an integrated tier 2 midwifery led stop smoking support service
success: Increase in maternal quit rates between booking and delivery. Shared and integrated learning across Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity Systems
update_2020: Service to be piloted in WsHT from January 2020 for 6 months, but not in other maternity accessed by west Sussex women.
update_2021: Update as ap 1.
latest_update: Standard procedure as part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Preventing ill health from alcohol and tobacco CQUIN
text: Support NHS achieve the preventing ill health from alcohol and tobacco CQUIN
success: Local NHS Trusts have achieved the CQUIN
update_2020: Western have set up a smoking strategy group. PH are supporting them with their business case and developing an information  leaflet for bedsides. MECC training delivered to staff.
update_2021: CQUIN no longer used as improvement plan framework. Focus now on Covid-19 recommencement plan.
latest_update: CQUIN no longer used as improvement plan framework, MECC training delivered to staff as alternative.

title: Training for primary care staff to deliver stop smoking services
text: Provide training for primary care staff to deliver stop smoking services
success: Primary care staff are able to deliver stop smoking services
update_2020: A total of 56 attendees have now received fact to face training with two more sessions scheduled for January and March 2020.
update_2021: Covid-19, we have moved to remote training delivery as a result. Training implementation now accessible and has shown good feedback to date.
latest_update: All contracted primary care staff have at least one trained professional and quarterly training sessions available for new members of staff.

title: Work with primary care service providers to improve services delivered
text: Work with primary care service providers to improve quantity and quality of services delivered
success: More stop smoking services within primary care
update_2020: Forum held in October in Crawley. Supported by PHE, Cancer Research, OnClick, Karen Davies, BHR, Wellbeing, West Sussex Resource lead Nicky Gale, WS Public Health Department, Share Celebrations and Q&A Physical Activity Guidelines Provider Support Marketplace Workshop 1: CVD Risk or Reducing Smoking Workshop 2: Quality Standards for Health Checks or E-Cigarette Guidance
update_2021: Covid-19, now face to face forums not possible. Online e-support sessions being planned for April 2021. Training provision and online support still readily available.
latest_update: Greater availability of support for service providers including e-support, improved training options and single point of contact from commissioner.

title: Home visiting staff trained in Make Every Contact Count (MECC)
text: Train Prevention Team home visiting staff in Make Every Contact Count (MECC)
success: Staff will be more confident in having signposting conversations about smoking cessation and making a record
update_2020: Face to face training has been booked for 11th February 2020
update_2021: Completed.
latest_update: All visiting staff trained in MECC as standard before commencing home visits.

title: Rollout Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to 30% of operational crews
text: Work with the Fire and Rescue Training and Development team to roll out Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to 30% of operational crews
success: 30% of operational personnel will be more confident in having signposting conversations about smoking cessation and recording
update_2020: MECC activity since April 2019 - 23 attendees across 15 organisations. 10 more upcoming events booked between Dec - Feb. The two trainers have now commenced and are working with the PH Programme Manager to develop workshop content for operational crews. The workshops will commence as part of years 2&3
update_2021: Completed.
latest_update: MECC training offered to all staff within service.

title: A Local Maternity System (LMS) wide action plan
text: A Local Maternity System (LMS) wide action plan will be developed
success: Plan developed for use by all organisations which are part of the local LMS.
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: On-going, funding bid imminent to hopefully secure service provision long term.
latest_update: Part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Carbon monoxide (CO) testing at antenatal appointments
text: Carbon monoxide (CO) testing at antenatal appointments for all pregnant women
success: All Pregnant women attending antenatal appointments will be CO tested
update_2020: New Maternity specification written by LMS is in line with NICE guidance and better birth guidance which includes Co testing at antenatal appointments.GP to check about WSHT
update_2021: Covid-19, following national guidance CO reading postponed however LMS have equipment and trained personnel to implement readings once face-to-face delivery can recommence.
latest_update: Standard procedure as part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Training delivered to all HCP staff involved in the care of pregnant women
text: Ensure training is delivered to all HCP staff involved in the care of pregnant women in the identification of smoking, delivery of smoking cessation advice and referring to smoking cessation services
success: Each organisation has training developed and available to relevant workforce.
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: Public Health working with LMS to identify a training solution.
latest_update: Standard procedure as part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Delivery of smoking brief advice to non-elective inpatients
text: Improve the delivery of smoking brief advice to non elective inpatients
success: Non elective inpatients receive appropriate advice and support to stop smoking
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: Pathway established and programme ready to commence delayed due to Covid-19 vaccination programme and lack of capacity to deliver it until this is completed. Reviewing this pathway to see if this can be established in other hospital settings.
latest_update: Very Brief Advice (VBA) training available to all staff.

title: Rollout Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to clinical and non-clinical staff
text: Rollout Make Every Contact Count (MECC) programme to clinical and non-clinical staff in healthcare settings such as primary care
success: Increased confidence of front line staff in raising the issue of smoking
update_2020: New person in place to deliver MECC training. Need an update from Dan/Andy on numbers delivered since April 2019.
update_2021: Short term secondment created to deliver training sessions face to face, following this an additional MECC module has been created on OnClick for providers to access.
latest_update: Making Every Contact Count (MECC) training available to all staff.

title: Signpost smokers to stop smoking services
text: Signpost smokers to stop smoking services when conducting Safe and Well visits
success: Increase in the number of people accessing the SSS
update_2020: A new IT system has been procured and will go live later this year. This will result in the more comprehensive data and the ability to report on those who are signposted. Training to use the new system will be supplemented by the workshops delivered with the support of the PH Programme Manager. This will increase the confident of operational crews to confident about sign posting people where appropriate.
update_2021: No update available.
latest_update: Given VBA and MECC training options, referral information known and available all staff engaging with West Sussex residents able to refer if deemed appropriate.

title: Wellbeing hub staff level 1 training
text: Wellbeing hub staff to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice level 1 training.
success: 1. All wellbeing staff will be VBA trained,            2. Wellbeing staff will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
update_2020: Completed. Ongoing for new staff coming through.
update_2021: Completed. Ongoing for new staff coming through.
latest_update: On-going quarterly training sessions available for all service providers.

title: Wellbeing hub staff level 2 training
text: Wellbeing hub staff to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice level 2 training.
success: 1. All wellbeing staff will be VBA trained,            2. Wellbeing staff will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
update_2020: Completed. Ongoing for new staff coming through.
update_2021: Completed. Ongoing for new staff coming through.
latest_update: On-going quarterly training sessions available for all service providers.

title: Midwives level 1 training
text: Midwives to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice on smoking for pregnant women level 1 to talk about smoking cessation with pregnant women and their partners
success: 1. All midwives will be VBA trained,            2. Midwives will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
update_2020: Our maternity in house stop smoking service plans to go live mid Jan 2020 (pending WSCC legal and contractual sign off). Huge thanks to WSCC for supporting this proof of concept model. I will be training our maternity support workers on the 18th December in appreciative inquiry (so that they are skilled in having difficult conversations) and they will also be completing the NCSCT e-learning at practitioner level. All the PGDs have passed successfully through the Trust's medicines management committee, which means our maternity support workers will be able to give NRT as part of this new service. This service will better support women to quit and remain smoke free as well as continue to signpost other family members to the existing stop smoking services. We will be running the proof of concept for 6 months initially and will closely monitor and evaluate to inform future commissioning.
update_2021: Public Health working with LMS to identify a training solution.
latest_update: Standard procedure as part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Safe and Well visits to test individual levels of carbon monoxide
text: Use carbon monoxide (CO) Monitors during Safe and Well Visits to test individual levels of CO
success: Identify people who have high levels of CO in their breath and to raise awareness of the impact from smoking
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: Covid-19, face to face visited severely impacted.
latest_update: Challenges with Covid-19 mean this was deprioritised, may be reviewed in subsequent action plan. Information and signposting to existing services is however carried out on visits.

title: Disrupt the supply of illicit tobacco
text: Continue to disrupt the supply of illicit tobacco in West Sussex
success: More traders brought into  compliance, increase in numbers of seizures and quantities seized
update_2020: 40/43 = 93% of intel targets actioned.
update_2021: Since 1st April 2020, Trading Standards have seized 5,198 cigarette packets & 1,236 tobacco pouches with an estimated retail value of £86,892.
latest_update: On-going work continuing.

title: Educate consumers of illicit tobacco
text: Educate consumers of issues with illicit tobacco and how to report it
success: Increase in intelligence and intel reported
update_2020: Ongoing Social Media messages
update_2021: Ongoing Social Media messages
latest_update: On-going work with social media messaging.

title: Clear reporting mechanisms for illicit tobacco among midwives
text: If staff are aware that illicit tobacco is being used they know how to report
success: Increase in the number of IT reports to Trading Standards
partners: Maternity at Western Hospitals, Wellbeing programme
update_2020: Not started.
update_2021: Not started.
latest_update: No update available.

title: Review Smoke Free West Sussex Partnership membership
text: Review Smoke Free West Sussex Partnership membership
success: A partnership that actively discusses and addresses through working together the tobacco issues in West Sussex
update_2020: This needs to be pushed back to new financial year.
update_2021: Covid-19, to be assessed as part of recommencement and partnership moving forward.
latest_update: Discussion around Smokefree membership and terms of reference held with partnership, terms of reference reviewed in line with new national guidance and local strategy now agreed.

title: Link messages into community and voluntary sector organisations
text: Link messages regarding tobacco control into community and voluntary sector organisations
success: Communities team raise tobacco control at a minimum of two events per year
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: Will look to build on SFWSP and establish wider network to promote messages through.
latest_update: Smokefree partnership continue to link joined up communications with their own networks.

title: Link tobacco control messages into directorate team meetings
text: Link messages regarding tobacco control into directorate team meetings
success: Tobacco control raised at a minimum of two  C&PP directorate management team meetings a year
update_2020: No update available.
update_2021: Complete, messages linked into individual teams within the directorate. Links stablished for promoting priority health messages into our community networks. Team leads and all partnerships officers are briefed on messages to go out.
latest_update: Links established and promotion of priority health messaging sent through community networks.

title: Raise the issue of tobacco control in West Sussex
text: Support members and the Director of Public Health in West Sussex to raise the issue of tobacco control
success: Whole system approaches to tobacco control embedded  and health in all policies include tobacco control
update_2020: CAB, SASH, strategy has been shared with other Local Authorities. One year on event. HF write a few lines
update_2021: Progression made so that this is now considered best practice and standard amongst all.
latest_update: All partners agreed on current approach as part of best practice.

title: Under age sales operations on intel led targets
text: Continue to undertake under age sales operations on intel led targets
success: Reduction in 'hit rates' of sales in UAS operations
update_2020: 2/17 = 12% of underage sale operations resulted in sale of tobacco to under age persons.
update_2021: Covid-19, no operations since Feb 2020.
latest_update: Operations on-going.

title: Educating businesses in under age sales legislation
text: Educate businesses in West Sussex in under age sales legislation
success: Increased number of businesses with knowledge of UAS legislation and engagement with TS
update_2020: Distribution of information drinks mats to targeted pubs at known hotspots for illicit tobacco.
update_2021: Covid-19, limited activity.
latest_update: Operations on-going.

title: Understanding attitudes to smoking among young people in West Sussex
text: Increase local understanding of attitudes to smoking of young people in West Sussex
success: Appropriate interventions developed based on insight
update_2020: Additional contacts with youth groups to run some insight sessions in the new year.
update_2021: Initial scoping and research being undertaken with youth committees and groups early in 2021, with learning hoping to shape future progression latterly in 2021.
latest_update: Initial scoping and research concluded, insight and evaluation will be used to progress strategy and future service provision.

title: Support the Local Maternity System
text: Support the Local Maternity System to achieve its aspirations related to tobacco control
success: LMS has achieved its aspirations
update_2020: PH funding being provided for a 15 month pilot of a MSW led service in WSHT starting in January 2020
update_2021: 12 of 15 months into pilot programme, which is being extended for a further 6 months to the end of Sept 2021. Integrated pathway established for those needing support either within LMS or referred to community wellbeing if more suitable for patient. Report on 1st year performance of programme due March 2021
latest_update: West Sussex Public Health to continue to support and advise as Long Term Plan services are progressed.

title: Investigate efficacy of interventions for young people
text: Investigate efficacy of prevention and smoking cessation interventions for young people
success: Awareness of appropriate interventions for preventing the uptake of smoking among young people as well as helping them stop. This will be through a review of published and grey literature and other social research methods.
update_2020: Evidence review completed and recommendations being considered.
update_2021: This will be progressed from learning gained once action 64 (Increase local understanding of attitudes to smoking of young people in West Sussex) has been completed.
latest_update: Further review and recommendation required to help shape future service provision.

title: Local Maternity System knowledgebase
text: Information on effects of smoking/smoking cessation services/smoke free homes included on LMS knowledgebase.
success: Increase in visits/hits to knowledgebase per year.
update_2020: Smoking during pregnancy and beyond webpage has had 127 visits since April 19. Myth Busting: Smoking during pregnancy page has had 51 visits since April 2019. And Smoke Free Home web page has had 81 visits to the site since April 2019.
update_2021:
Between 01/01/20 & 31/01/21
Smoking during pregnancy and beyond webpage has had 363 visits. Myth Busting: Smoking during pregnancy page has had 66 visits. And Smoke Free Home web page has had 164 visits.
latest_update: Literature available and part of Long Term Plan framework.

title: Nicotine Replacement Therapy available during hospital stay
text: Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) to be available to all pregnant women during hospital stay
success: An increase in the number of pregnant women on NRT during their hospital stay
update_2020: Move to 20/21 for discussion
update_2021: PH working on pilot with Acute trust, beginning with Respiratory wards in Western Sussex Hospitals.
latest_update: Standard procedure as part of NHS Long Term Plan framework.

title: Review workplace smokefree policies for local authorities
text: Review the smokefree policy for local authorities
success: Evidence based workplace policy in WSCC
update_2020: The WSCC smoking policy has been updated, and plans for the new year include embedding a smoke-free policy ready to launch in Jan 2021
update_2021: No update available.
latest_update: Smokefree Policies to form part of next strategy request to all partners.

title: Source extra provision via additional providers
text: Source extra provision via additional providers
success: Increase 1st appointments to pre-pandemic levels

title: Conduct a mid-year audit activity of current providers and offer support to inactive providers who wish to continue to provide services
text: Conduct a mid-year audit activity of current providers and offer support to inactive providers who wish to continue to provide services
success: Increase in the number of providers and the average activity level of active providers

title: Consider expansion of vape provision for those seeking support to quit
text: Consider expansion of vape provision for those seeking support to quit
success: Increase in the quit rate of services offering a free vape
partners: Public Health, GP practices, Pharmacies, Wellbeing

title: Develop a central triage/coordination model to ensure ease of access to services
text: Develop a central triage/coordination model to ensure ease of access to services
success: Increase in number of first appointments

title: Hospital Trust Inpatient tobacco dependence service rolled out across all sites over 2023/3
text: Hospital Trust Inpatient tobacco dependence service rolled out across all sites over 2023/3
success: To be confirmed

title: Deliver vape awareness session for providers
text: Deliver awareness session for providers and other key stakeholders regarding the use of vapes as a quit tool and myth busting
success: Increased proportion of providers feel confident to promote as a quit tool
partners: Public Health, GP practices, Pharmacies, Wellbeing

title: Expansion of CO monitors in wellbeing hubs
text: Expansion of CO monitors in wellbeing hubs
success: Improved quit rates

title: Provision of additional training for Family Nurse Partnership staff to deliver smoking cessation interventions to young parents
text: Provision of additional training for Family Nurse Partnership staff to deliver smoking cessation interventions to young parents
success: Increased quit rate in young parents

title: Targeted Stop Smoking communications
text: Targeted Stop Smoking communications campaign to groups at greater risk of smoking (Central and Eastern European groups, LGBTQ+ groups, people from deprived areas)
success: Increased uptake in first appointments in people from these groups

title: Promotion of smoking cessation in pubs/bars in deprived areas
text: Promotion of smoking cessation in pubs/bars in deprived areas
success: Increased uptake in first appointment in people from more deprived areas

title: Model the trajectory required to reach smokefree locally
text: Model the trajectory required to reach smokefree locally (prevalence <5%) by 2030
success: We have a clear understanding of the year on year reduction in prevalence we need to achieve to reach smokefree by 2030

title: Develop local mechanism to gather prevalence data in children and young people
text: Develop local mechanism to gather smoking and vaping prevalence data in children and young people
success: We are able to regularly measure smoking and vaping prevalence locally in Children and Young people

title: Develop whole-schools approach to smoking/vaping
text: Develop whole-schools approach to smoking/vaping
success: Shared understanding of the local issues and consensus on effective school-based approaches to reduce smoking/vaping in children and young people

title: Increase awareness of risks of vaping in children and young people
text: Education children, young people and parents/carers regarding the risks of vaping
success: Children, young people and their parents/carers are aware of the risks of vaping

title: Consider smoking KPI as part of Healthy Child Programme
text: Consider smoking KPI as part of Healthy Child Programme and ringfenced funding to tackle smoking/vaping in CYP via the programme
success: There is a specific focus on smoking and vaping within the Healthy Child Programme

title: Explore effectiveness of smokefree sidelines projects
text: Explore effectiveness of smokefree sidelines projects which aim to de-normalise smoking at grassroots football training and matches
success: Smoke Free environments promoted

title: Continue to disrupt the supply of illicit tobacco and vaping products in West Sussex
text: Continue to disrupt the supply of illicit tobacco and vaping products in West Sussex
success: More traders brought into compliance, increase in numbers of seizures and quantities seized

title: Continue to disrupt the supply of tobacco and vaping products sold to underage residents
text: Continue to disrupt the supply of tobacco and vaping products sold to underage residents
success: More traders brought into compliance

title: Financial incentive scheme developed for pregnant people
text: Financial incentive scheme developed for pregnant people engaged in the smokefree pregnancy service
success: Reduction in the proportion of pregnant people smoking at the time of delivery

title: Increase capacity of Smokefree pregnancy service
text: Increase capacity of Smokefree pregnancy service including increasing the digital offer
success: Reduction in the proportion of pregnant people smoking at the time of delivery

title: Consider the use of provider incentives to support increased quit rates in vulnerable groups
text: Consider the use of provider incentives to support increased quit rates in vulnerable groups
success: Increased quit rates in vulnerable groups
partners: Public Health, GP practices, Pharmacies, Wellbeing

title: Embed smoking cessation signposting within housing associations
text: Embed smoking cessation signposting within Ds and Bs to support those in Local Authority rented or housing association accommodation
success: Increased quit rates in people in social housing

title: Explore the co-location of services for vulnerable groups
text: Explore the co-location of services for vulnerable groups, such as people with serious mental health conditions
success: Reduced smoking prevalence in vulnerable groups

title: Establish formal support for housebound smokers
text: Establish formal support for housebound smokers
success: Fewer smoking related housefires.

title: Refresh the Tobacco Control Needs Assessment
text: Refresh the Tobacco Control Needs Assessment
success: Improved insight and intelligence into the needs and experiences of tobacco users

title: Develop communications relating to the cost of smoking and support available to quit
text: Develop communications relating to the cost of smoking and support available to quit
success: Increased uptake in first appointment in people from more deprived areas
